Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI's efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI's biggest rival, according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.
Sourcing Table.Name of Source: Email from Sam Altman to colleagues
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Internal communication that shows Altman's perspective on Helen Toner's research paper

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.
Sourcing Table.Name of Source: Email from Sam Altman to colleagues
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Internal communication that shows Altman's perspective on Helen Toner's research paper

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Senior OpenAI leaders, including Mr. Sutskever, who is deeply concerned that A.I. could one day destroy humanity, later discussed whether Ms. Toner should be removed, a person involved in the conversations said.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: A person who had direct knowledge of internal conversations among OpenAI leadership

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: But shortly after those discussions, Mr. Sutskever did the unexpected: He sided with board members to oust Mr. Altman, according to two people familiar with the board's deliberations. The statement he read to Mr. Altman said that Mr. Altman was being fired because he wasn't
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Two people with direct knowledge of the board's internal deliberations

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Mr. Sutskever's frustration with Mr. Altman echoed what had happened in 2021 when another senior A.I. scientist left OpenAI to form Anthropic. That scientist and other researchers went to the board to try to push Mr. Altman out. After they failed, they gave up and departed, according to three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Three people with direct knowledge of the previous attempt to remove Altman

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: After vetting four candidates for one position, the remaining directors couldn't agree on who should fill it, said the two people familiar with the board's deliberations. The stalemate hardened the divide between Mr. Altman and Mr. Brockman and other board members.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Two people with direct knowledge of the board's internal deliberations

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Hours after Mr. Altman was ousted, OpenAI executives confronted the remaining board members during a video call, according to three people who were on the call.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Three people who directly participated in the video call between OpenAI executives and board members

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: During the call, Jason Kwon, OpenAI's chief strategy officer, said the board was endangering the future of the company by pushing out Mr. Altman. This, he said, violated the members' responsibilities.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: A senior executive at OpenAI who confronted the board during a video call after Altman's ouster

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Ms. Toner disagreed. The board's mission was to ensure that the company creates artificial intelligence that
and if the company was destroyed, she said, that could be consistent with its mission. In the board's view, OpenAI would be stronger without Mr. Altman.
Sourcing Table.Title of Source: OpenAI board member and director of strategy at Georgetown University's Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Board member responding during the confrontational video call with OpenAI executives

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: On Sunday, Mr. Sutskever was urged at OpenAI's office to reverse course by Mr. Brockman's wife, Anna, according to two people familiar with the exchange. Hours later, he signed a letter with other employees that demanded the independent directors resign. The confrontation between Mr. Sutskever and Ms. Brockman was reported earlier by The Wall Street Journal.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Two people with knowledge of the private conversation between Anna Brockman and Ilya Sutskever
